law.catch_line: Nonresident accompanying resident fur buyer -- Presumption from.
law.text: In any prosecution of a nonresident from buying raw fur or furs without a fur buyer's license, proof that such person was in the company of a resident fur buyer at the time the latter purchased a raw fur shall constitute a prima facie evidence that such nonresident was engaged in the business of buying raw furs without a license.
law.history: Amended 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 200, sec. 60, effective June 19, 1952. -- Created 1946 Ky. Acts ch. 84, sec. 22.
